turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: But what if Solaris is what there was before The Big Bang?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: As I said, it is beyond our comprehension.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: As I said, then it's God, right?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You were trying to break down the door.  Do you know why?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: When I saw you were gone I got scared.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I been thinking about how much I hate you.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I would have these -- I don't know how to describe them -- visions, when I was younger.  Maybe not visions, but like these waking dream states.  Time would just collapse, I would be inside time.  I would stare at a second hand on a clock until it stopped.  Freaky stuff.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Seven, eight.  So one day my mother catches me sort of staring off into space, and she asks me what I'm doing, and I start trying to explain to her, about this state that I can put myself in, and this look comes over her face.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Scared.  No, not scared.  Wary. Like I was something to be... her guard went up.  I was a threat.  Now I know why.  She was afraid she'd be seen.  That I would see her for the self-obsessed neurotic that she was. I think she thought she had a few more years of being on a pedestal. But that's the cycle, right?  I knew a little more than she did, she knew a little more than her mother, and on and on.  I guess that's part of the reason why --

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I know.  I know.  We don't have to talk about that.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Thinking what you were doing and saying, just being consumed by thinking of you.  I loved it so much, that feeling.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Why did you say those things?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I don't know.  I couldn't understand why you didn't tell me.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I can't help feeling that I'm cheating when I take them.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: It's genetics.  You know this.  You know where it comes from.  There is nothing wrong with uncrossing a few crossed wires.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Do you have any idea how much I like fucking you?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Good.  Because I want you to know. I really like fucking you.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: How could she not be real?  I can smell her, taste her.  She does exactly what she did... it's not possible.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You know, I've decided: I'm just gonna believe what you believe about this whole Solaris thing, it'll make life so much easier; the little wife agreeing with her big, strong husband. You must get such a headache thinking about those Great Big Problems all day.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You sure say "God" a lot when we're doing it.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I know.  I'm putting that in my next report.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: What does Snow think you should do?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Snow thinks we shouldn't leave until we figure out a way to document it, to prove its existence to the planet Earth.  This is hilarious: He thinks it's God, but he wants it to sit still for a photograph so he can show the folks back home.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Well.  He doesn't think it's God, but for different reasons than me. He's thinking: If I can figure out how to make it stop, than I am smarter than it is, and therefore it cannot be God.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: He does have a point.  That's just not the way I'd like to see it proven.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You feel sorry for Solaris, or for me?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: It's a violent response to something we haven't figured out.  Don't let the cowardly demeanor fool you: He is ruthless.  Unblinking in his prejudice.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: It was obvious from the way he first looked at me.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Do I really feel like... I am...?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: That I am not Rheya.  That Rheya died.  Killed herself.  I'm different.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Who have you been talking to?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I'm sure there are worse people to talk to, but I don't know who they are.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I'm just trying to understand what's going on.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You... she said I didn't love her.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I don't think do.  It's not sleep; it's something else.  It's all around me.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Don't debate him; he'll say anything.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I'm just as human as you.  I see, I hear, I touch, and I feel just like you do.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: That's what you were saying.  I heard what you were saying.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: For a reason that neither of us understand, you are forced to stay near me.  That's all I know right now.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I have these strange thoughts, I don't know where they come from.  I can't explain it.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Neither can I.  Not any of it. There's no reference point for what's going on; it's never happened before. It's a clean break in the fabric of the Universe; a gap.  There is nothing to do but experience it, moment-to- moment, and not let it destroy us.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Do you want to stay here?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: He is.  But he was here...

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Please don't lie.  I told you before, I don't know how I came to be here. Whatever you think you can't say to me, I need to hear you say it.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Don't.  I'm the one at risk here. If we're playing out what happened before, I won't survive.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: That won't happen again.  We're different.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: How can I tell?  You've seen both of me.  I only know what you're like here.  You're all I know.  There is no "You" from before.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: How could it be so cruel?  How could it torture us like this?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I don't think it knows it's torturing us.  It's just watching.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I'm not Rheya.  You've always known that.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Listen: I don't care about anything but the fact that you are here.  You are her, you are Rheya.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Rheya, I am not going back.  I'm staying here with you.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I want every second I can get with you.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Don't do this.  I am literally begging you not to do this.  Chris.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: It wouldn't have made any difference.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Chris, I had to.  I had to.  I didn't think you'd react like this.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You never said you wanted one.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Chris, please.  Chris, I'm serious. I won't make it.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: What do I have to do to stop it?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You exist here.  I keep telling you.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I... I am Rheya.  But I am not the woman you loved ten years ago.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Did you hear what Gibarian said? I'm not a human being.  I'm an instrument.  I came from your memory and your imagination and I will torture you no matter what.  Even if I remain passive.  That's when I drank the...  I was going mad.  It felt like there was no body underneath my skin. There was something else.  An illusion.  But I could feel my heart beating, and I remembered you tested my blood.  Is it like yours?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Yes.  I told you.  It was exactly like mine.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: But then I would be dead now.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Is that really what you want?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I want to stop taking those pills.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: They do something to me.  It's hard to think straight.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I have consciousness, but I am not mortal.  Don't you see why I'm going crazy?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You have to remember that I love you, that's all that matters --

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: It put you here.  I'll admit it, it acted like a God and put you here, put you into my consciousness.  I was asleep, and it put you into my dream.  I saw your mouth.  And there you were.  Whether you've been sent here to make me happy or punish me, it doesn't matter.  The decision we make now is all that matters.  Stay with me.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I don't know anymore.  All I see is you.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: A sleeping pill.  Do you want yours?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I've decided that if it is God, it's a sick God.  Its ambitions exceed its powers, but it doesn't realize it.  It's created a situation without a goal, and I hate that.  A God whose passion is not a redemption, who saves nothing, fulfills no purpose.  And us?  We would have to have "an arrangement".  An unspoken understanding that I am not human. How can I not hate something that does that?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Last night.  You were talking to someone in the corridor.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Shhhh.  Just stay with me.  Stay with me.  Everything is forgiven. Everything.

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: We thought you'd be alone.  We want to talk about...

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: They are not autonomous individuals and they're not actual persons. They are projections materializing from our minds, based on a given individual.

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: A recoil, with no compensating mechanism.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: And when a given situation no longer corresponds to the normal faculties of the... original, the visitor suffers some sort of disconnected consciousness.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Are the actions of Solaris premeditated?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Gibarian was helpless.  It's very simple: Man created the science that resulted in the discovery of Solaris, and the ship that brought us here.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: I got rid of him.  I wanted to see if... I wanted to be the only one. I wanted to be Snow.

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: You want it coming back with us?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: You go ahead.  Of what I remember about Earth... it's all one thing now.  Everything's a blur.  I like distinctions.

turns.speaker: WIN
turns.text: Skiddy and Kit?  I haven't seen them since that shitty pasta dinner on the cape.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: They've got two monsters now.  Both boys.

turns.speaker: WIN
turns.text: And so what's with Steinhart?  Is it serious?

turns.speaker: WIN
turns.text: Looks a little constipated to me.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: It's called "solid"... Nice to find someone you can count on, Win.

turns.speaker: WIN
turns.text: You still writing the occasional magazine article?

turns.speaker: WIN
turns.text: Then c'mon.  Follow me.  The art's in the basement, you're going to get a privileged peek.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I've never seen anyone killed before.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's okay... I've never been a detective before either...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hard to find doors in this place.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm not sure how this works.  I have to go out... is that all right?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I have to pick something up before Bergdorf's closes, then stop at a reception just a few blocks away.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I think, maybe, that isn't such a great idea...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Lieutenant Garber said that in all likelihood there was no real danger, is that true?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: There's a phone in the car.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Do you have another tie?  Something more conservative?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh... Yes... I don't have it with me.  It's at home.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: He thinks you're being a little careless.  He made the point several times.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: My father founded a music school there.  The Milton Gregory School.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm supposed to speak at their tenth anniversary.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Nice.  Maybe you'll stop by... have an aperitif...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Would you pick one out, please?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Since you're going to be my escort, you'll need a new tie.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Put it on my account, please.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You can touch me, I won't bite.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: People think I'm stepping out on Neil.  We're causing quite a scandal.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey!  There are crazy people here.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'll have a spritzer, order something soft for yourself... I must go for a pee.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I think I can probably do that on my own.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Hi.  Just checking to see if you're here.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I shouldn't have listened to you, I should've followed you right into the "can" the way he did.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: If I had known I was going to have company, he was right next to me.  I think he heard me peeing!  I hate that, I am glad he's in jail.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I guess I'm supposed to do it in the morning.  Identify him.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Right.  How could he do that if he's in jail and they've thrown away the key...?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You wouldn't happen to know what language they speak in India, do you?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Didn't do very well, did you?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Nope... never finished one yet.  I hate these things.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You put it back in the wrong place... Do you like Renoir?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You know why they're like that...? He was myopic... going blind.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: So, this could be your last night, huh?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Want to go out for a drink?  I mean, we're both sitting here, and Joey Venza's in jail...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, I like that!  Where you go, I follow.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You mean to tell me, a mugger would stay away from someone because they walked a certain way?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: That's the dumbest walk I ever saw!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No, no seriously!  There's a study done on this, you walk this way, the muggers are gonna single you out.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: And die laughing, because you're walking so stupid!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey.  This is my business.  Do I tell you your business.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Okay.  Let's just see if a mugger gets me.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ... It was like... the minute I saw her... I knew.  She looked so damn adorable in a cop's uniform... puttin' on a big, tough act...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: That's nice.  And you live in Queens?  With a child, and a dog...?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I saw you with a dog, in my mind.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You don't like him, do you?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: He's very caring, in his way.  You haven't seen him at his best.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: It was nice having you "watch over me"...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah.  I liked being around you too... Claire.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's just me.  I want to talk to you.  Let me in...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You put me life in danger.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No, you'll be safe.  We're gonna pick him up again...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: And then what?  I'll never be safe. I'll have to leave the country!  You can't protect me, and you can't keep him in jail!  And you knew that all the goddamn time!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You told me I'm safe?  I'm going for a walk in the park.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm perfectly calm, I'm a normal human being.  I'm going for a walk in the park.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I trusted you!  I thought you cared about me?!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: More bullshit!  More bullshit!  What kind of odds are they giving me?  There must be some kind of office pool.  One month?  A couple of days?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: They called here after you left...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: This is me, Mike.  There's nothing else...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You don't wash your clothes at the Boulevard Laundromat... you don't pick up your kids from some crummy public school... what is this?  A fuckin' joke?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Okay, then let's make it easy.  It was a mistake.  Don't make me feel guilty now that it's over, let's forget about it.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Oh, I do want to know.  I tried to reach you at the precinct.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I've moved into Scotty's... Good news about T.J., though.  Looks like that tough son of a gun is gonna pull through.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Oh, I'm fine.  They've replaced you with quite an entourage.  It's a regular "marching band".  You should see me on the street, you'd think I was the First Lady --

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm taking them all out to Queens, as a matter of fact, right in your neighborhood.  There's an event at my Father's school... an anniversary... I thought maybe you could come...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm going away after that, the next morning.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Pretty far.  I'm told not to say anything about it on the phone, in case it's tapped... they think it's best, safer, if I go away, at least till Venza's found.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I don't know.  Garber's left orders here not to let you in the building.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh yeah.  When is it?  This thing in Queens.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know.  It wouldn't be very smart.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Listen, you're right.  Don't do it. I'll just... send you an address, okay?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No really, it's okay, I've gotta go. I'm expecting some calls.  I'll be fine, really.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: They guys treatin' you all right?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I've been doing a lot of thinking.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How long you going away for?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'll have to pack a lot of clothes.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's Venza.  He wants you.  You, for Ellie and Tommy.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I think it's probably still a good idea.
